channel.title: Roberto Allende
channel.description: AI-first engineering leader, builder, and football coach based in New Zealand. Notes on technology, leadership, learning, and the work in between.

item.title: [Software] Find new AWS Builder articles on X
item.description: uAWSBuilderFeed is an unofficial automated feed that republishes AWS Builder articles to X.

item.title: [Software] Build and ship an entire app using Amazon Q
item.description:
How the AWS Lambda Hackathon let me stress test an idea that ended up transforming how I work with Q CLI to develop software.
This post is based on a presentation at AWS Community Day 2025, New Zealand, Aotearoa.

item.title: [Software] Not a portfolio. Not a blog. A conversation
item.description:
A few days ago, I came across the AWS Builder Challenge—and I couldn’t resist.
I love these sprints: the adrenaline of a deadline, the chance to challenge assumptions, and the opportunity to try and learn something new.

item.title: [Software] Code with AI: Micromanagement is all you need
item.description: Yes, it says micromanagement - and this time it makes sense.

item.title: [Software] Five Takeaways from AWS Summit Sydney 2025
item.description: June 4-5, 2025 saw AWS bring together thousands of developers, builders, and business leaders at Sydney's International Convention Centre for their annual Summit. Across 90+ sessions and 80+ partner showcases, the event highlighted both where AWS is directing their efforts and how customers are putting those tools to work Amazon— here are five things that stood out to me from the two days.
